intro: Malabaila erbilensis, commonly known as the Erbil mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iraq. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Malabaila erbilensis thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky slopes and in open woodlands.
